title: Western Viewers, Eastern Subjects: Scenes of Empire from the Illustrated Plate Books in the Mrs. James Ward Thorne Collection
short_description: Britain’s triumph over France in the Seven Years’ War marked its emergence as a global power. The Franco-British Treaty of Paris (1763) gave Britain control over India, which in turn encouraged British citizens to travel to the subcontinent. In the later 18th century, a series of British military victories in India intensified interest in the new colony among the British public.

input: Western Viewers, Eastern Subjects: Scenes of Empire from the Illustrated Plate Books in the Mrs. James Ward Thorne Collection
